item.title: Assam reports first HMPV case this season as 10-month-old child tests positive in Dibrugarh - Hindustan Times
item.description:
Assam Reports First Case of HMPV Infection This Season

Date: Jan 11, 2025 | Source: Hindustan Times

Assam has reported its first case of human metapneumovirus (HMPV) infection this season, with a 10-month-old child testing positive. The infant is currently undergoing treatment at Assam Medical College and Hospital (AMCH) in Dibrugarh and is said to be stable.

  • Ten-month-old child tests positive for HMPV in Dibrugarh, Assam.
  • Child admitted to AMCH with cold-related symptoms four days ago.
  • HMPV infection confirmed by ICMR-RMRC Lahowal after routine tests.
  • HMPV is a common respiratory virus that usually causes mild symptoms.
  • Similar HMPV cases reported in Gujarat, Maharashtra, Karnataka, and Tamil Nadu.
“The HMPV infection was confirmed yesterday after we got test results from Lahowal-based ICMR-RMRC. The child is stable now. It is a common virus, and there is nothing to worry about.” - Dr. Dhrubajyoti Bhuyan, AMCH superintendent

The detection of HMPV is not unusual, as the virus circulates seasonally and typically impacts infants and individuals with weaker immune systems more severely.

item.title: Train to Kashmir will start very soon: Ashwini Vaishnaw - Greater Kashmir
item.description:
Train Services to Kashmir Set to Launch Soon, Says Minister Ashwini Vaishnaw

Date: January 11 | Source: Chennai

Minister of Railways Ashwini Vaishnaw has announced that the long-anticipated train service connecting Jammu and Kashmir will commence shortly.

  • The project involves a 111-kilometre railway line, mostly consisting of tunnels and bridges.
  • A special Vande Bharat train has been designed to operate in extreme weather conditions.
  • A successful speed trial was conducted in recent inspections, paving the way for the launch.
“This is a highly complex project and the dream has now been fulfilled.”

This project marks a significant achievement in India’s railway sector, aiming to enhance connectivity and support regional development.

item.title: As Dhananjay Munde row continues to spiral in Maharashtra, BJP keeps a watch, Delhi takes note - The Indian Express
item.description:
Maharashtra Political Turmoil: Calls for Dhananjay Munde's Resignation Intensify

Publication Date: October 2023 Source: Indian Express

The recent surrender of Walmik Kharad, an aide to NCP Minister Dhananjay Munde, in a murder case has sparked political upheaval in Maharashtra, with mounting pressure for Munde's resignation and scrutiny of the investigation.

  • The Maharashtra CID and a Special Investigation Team are currently handling the murder case of Massajog sarpanch Santosh Deshmukh.
  • Opposition parties are questioning the delay in Kharad's surrender and the status of another accused still at large.
  • BJP MLA Suresh Dhas is vocal about demanding Munde's resignation.
  • Munde has faced allegations of coercion regarding a land sale, further complicating his position.
  • Chief Minister Devendra Fadnavis stated that all involved in the crime will be punished, with ongoing investigations expected to reveal more.
  • The BJP leadership is monitoring the situation closely, with factors from coalition politics influencing potential actions against Munde.
  • Maratha-OBC tensions are heightened, as activists call for demonstrations if justice is not served in the murder case.
“We will hold demonstrations across Maharashtra till justice is given to the sarpanch’s family members.” – Manoj Jarange Patil

This political saga reflects the complexities within Maharashtra's coalition government and shows how interconnected issues of crime and caste politics can affect leadership stability.

item.title: Delhi Weather Update: Thunderstorms and rain forecasted as dense fog disrupts flights and trains - Moneycontrol
item.description:
Delhi Weather Update: Thunderstorms and Rain Forecast as Fog Disrupts Services

Date: January 11, 2025 / Source: Moneycontrol

Delhi experienced dense fog and cold wave conditions, affecting flights and train services significantly.

  • Over 100 flights were delayed at Indira Gandhi International Airport due to low visibility.
  • The IMD issued a yellow alert predicting thunderstorms and rain.
  • Fog visibility in Delhi and surrounding areas was less than 50 meters in some regions.
Visibility reduced to zero as a blanket of dense fog witnessed in parts of Delhi-NCR.

The weather conditions are expected to continue impacting travel and air quality.

item.title: Wife Can Claim Maintenance From Husband Even If She Doesn't Live With Him As Per Decree On Conjugal... - Live Law - Indian Legal News
item.description:
Supreme Court Rules Wife Can Claim Maintenance Without Residing with Husband

Publication Date: [Insert Date Here] Source: Live Law

In a significant ruling, the Supreme Court stated that a wife is entitled to claim maintenance even if she refuses to live with her husband, despite a decree of restitution of conjugal rights.

  • The Court highlighted that a husband cannot deny maintenance simply because his wife does not live with him.
  • The ruling stemmed from a case where the wife suffered mistreatment and a miscarriage, justifying her refusal to return to the matrimonial home.
  • The husband's argument that the wife’s non-compliance with the decree exempted him from paying maintenance was rejected by the Court.
  • The Court emphasized that Section 125 Cr.P.C. exists to prevent destitution and applies regardless of marital disputes.
“Dinesh's attempts to evade responsibility clearly reflect a lack of bona fides,” the Court observed.

The Supreme Court reversed the Jharkhand High Court’s earlier decision, reaffirming the right of the wife to maintenance.

item.title: Pregnant Woman Dies, 5 Critical After Being Injected 'Expired' Saline At Midnapore Hospital - News18
item.description:
Pregnant Woman Dies, 5 Critical After Being Injected 'Expired' Saline At Midnapore Hospital

Date: January 11, 2025 | Source: News18

A tragic incident at Midnapore Medical College and Hospital involves the administration of expired saline, leading to the death of a pregnant woman and critically ill conditions for five others.

  • A 10-member inquiry committee from the West Bengal Health Department will investigate the incident.
  • The health department has ordered the replacement of the current saline stock.
  • The deceased, Mamoni Rui Das (21), had given birth shortly before her condition deteriorated.
  • Opposition parties criticized the state government over the incident, demanding accountability.
“Shame on the crumbling healthcare system in West Bengal under the disastrous regime of @MamataOfficial! A pregnant woman DIED after being given EXPIRED saline at a govt hospital in Midnapore, and several others now fight for their lives.” — BJP West Bengal

This incident raises significant concerns about healthcare standards in West Bengal, demanding immediate governmental accountability and reform.

item.title: Assam mine tragedy: 2nd body recovered as rescue ops enters 6th day - The Times of India
item.description:
Assam mine tragedy: 2nd body recovered as rescue ops enters 6th day

Date: [Insert publication date] Source: [Insert source]

Rescue operations continue in Assam following a tragic mine accident that has now entered its sixth day. The efforts have led to the recovery of a second body.

  • Second body recovered during ongoing rescue operations.
  • Rescue efforts have faced challenges due to difficult terrain.
  • Families of the victims are awaiting news and support.
“We are working tirelessly to recover all trapped miners,” said a rescue official.

The recovery of bodies, while tragic, highlights the urgent need for safety reforms in mining operations in the region.

item.title: Madhya Pradesh: IT officials find crocodiles during raid on former BJP MLA's house - Hindustan Times
item.description:
Crocodiles Discovered During IT Raid on Former BJP MLA's Property in Madhya Pradesh

Date: Jan 11, 2025 | Source: Hindustan Times

Income Tax officials raiding the property of former BJP MLA Harvansh Singh Rathore in Madhya Pradesh's Sagar district were astonished to discover crocodiles on the premises, alongside significant tax evasion findings.

  • The raid was linked to alleged tax evasion amounting to ₹155 crore.
  • IT officials seized ₹3 crore in cash and various valuables including gold and silver jewellery.
  • The reptiles were found in a pond and were rescued with the involvement of the forest department.
  • Rajesh Kesarwani, Rathore's business associate, is reportedly at the center of the tax evasion case.
  • The health of the rescued crocodiles is currently under examination.
“The health of the crocodiles is being examined. We will inform the court about them and proceed accordingly.”

This incident highlights the unusual circumstances surrounding the tax evasion case, blending wildlife concerns with financial misconduct.

item.title: AAP MLA Gurpreet Gogi dies after ‘accidentally’ shooting himself, says police - The Hindu
item.description:
AAP MLA Gurpreet Gogi dies after ‘accidentally’ shooting himself, says police

Date: January 11, 2025 | Source: The Hindu

Aam Aadmi Party (AAP) MLA Gurpreet Bassi Gogi has died from gunshot injuries, reportedly from an accidental discharge of his own licensed pistol.

  • Gurpreet Gogi sustained injuries to his head around midnight.
  • He was declared dead upon arrival at DMC hospital.
  • Deputy Commissioner of Police stated it appears to be a case of accidental fire.
  • A cause of death will be confirmed after the post-mortem report.
  • Gogi joined AAP in 2022, winning against former Congress MLA Bharat Bhushan Ashu.
“Cause of the death will be clear once the post-mortem reports come.” - Deputy Commissioner of Police Jaskaran Singh

Investigations are ongoing into the circumstances surrounding Gogi's death.

item.title: AAP MLA Gurpreet Gogi shoots himself accidentally, declared dead - The Hindu
item.description:
AAP MLA Gurpreet Gogi Accidentally Shoots Himself and is Declared Dead

Publication Date: January 11, 2025 Source: The Hindu

Aam Aadmi Party (AAP) MLA Gurpreet Gogi has been pronounced dead after accidentally shooting himself, resulting in serious head injuries. The incident took place around midnight.

  • Gurpreet Gogi sustained bullet injuries to his head and was declared dead at the hospital.
  • The Deputy Commissioner of Police stated that the shooting was accidental as per family accounts.
  • The cause of death will be confirmed once the post-mortem report is available.
  • Gogi, who joined AAP in 2022, previously defeated a two-time Congress MLA during the Ludhiana assembly elections.
“The incident happened around midnight, and he was declared dead when he was brought to the DMC hospital...” - DCP Jaskaran Singh

Further investigations into the incident are currently underway.

item.title: Dense fog in Delhi, Noida, flight ops normal, 45 trains delayed; rain, thunderstorm expected today - Hindustan Times
item.description:
Dense Fog Causes Flight and Train Delays in Delhi and Noida

Date: Jan 11, 2025

Source: Hindustan Times

Moderate to dense fog continues to impact flight and train operations in Delhi and surrounding areas, with more than 100 flights and several trains delayed.

  • Impact on Transportation: Delhi's IGI airport issued multiple advisories for passengers to check flight statuses due to dense fog causing delays.
  • Weather Conditions: The India Meteorological Department (IMD) forecasted light rain and thunderstorms over the weekend amidst the fog.
  • Air Quality Index: AQI reached 'severe' levels, going above 400.
  • Train Delays: 45 trains experienced delays due to low visibility conditions.
  • Accidents: Reduced visibility led to multiple accidents including a serious incident involving a bus collision with a truck.
“Fog reduced visibility to zero in parts of Delhi, Ghaziabad, Noida and other areas of the national capital region.”

The combination of dense fog and poor air quality has led to significant disruptions in travel across Delhi and Noida, emphasizing the need for weather preparedness and caution among commuters.

item.title: Delhi-NCR foggy, rain expected; flight and train operations likely to be hit again - Hindustan Times
item.description:
Delhi-NCR foggy, rain expected; flight and train operations likely to be hit again

Date: January 11, 2025

Source: Hindustan Times

The national capital is experiencing dense fog, which severely reduced visibility, causing over 100 flights and several train services to be delayed. The weather is expected to continue affecting transportation, with rain predicted over the weekend.

  • Flight and train delays: Zero visibility due to fog has significantly disrupted flight and train operations, leading to multiple advisories issued by IGI airport.
  • Rain predictions: Light rain and thunderstorms are anticipated, with current temperatures below normal.
  • Air Quality Index (AQI): The AQI reached 'severe' levels, peaking at 409 due to high pollution levels.
  • Accidents linked to fog: Multiple accidents occurred due to low visibility, causing injuries and fatalities.
"Dense fog was seen in parts of Delhi on Saturday morning, leading to the delay of 100 flights and several trains."

Overall, the persistent fog and deteriorating air quality continue to pose challenges for residents and transportation in the Delhi-NCR region.

item.title: Trapped Assam miners' leader arrested, rescue operation enters Day 5 - The Times of India
item.description:
Trapped Assam miners' leader arrested, rescue operation enters Day 5

Date: [insert publication date here] Source: [insert source here]

The rescue operation for the trapped miners in Assam has now entered its fifth day, following the arrest of a key leader advocating for their release.

  • Rescue teams are continuing their efforts to reach the miners trapped underground.
  • The arrest of the miners' leader has sparked protests and raised concerns about their safety.
  • Authorities are facing criticism for the handling of the rescue operation.
“We demand action and transparency in the rescue efforts,” said a spokesperson for the miners' families.

This situation highlights the challenges faced in rescue operations in such environments, and the pressing need for effective emergency response strategies.

item.title: Mumbai: Ukrainian masterminds fled India under garb of Christmas leave - The Indian Express
item.description:
Torres Fraud: Ukrainian Masterminds Flee India During Christmas Leave

Publication Date: January 10, 2025 Source: Indian Express

An investigation by the Mumbai police Economic Offences Wing (EOW) has found that the two suspected Ukrainian masterminds of the Torres investment fraud case escaped the country in December 2024 after telling staff and agents they were going on Christmas leave.

  • Victoriia Kovalenko and Olena Stoian are suspected masterminds behind the fraud.
  • The EOW is investigating links to a similar mass fraud in Turkey.
  • Three additional arrests have been made in relation to the Ponzi scheme.
  • A substantial amount of cash has been seized during the investigation, including Rs 5 crore from multiple locations.
  • A heated argument at the Dadar store revealed financial irregularities, prompting investor action.
  • A gathering of around 600 investors led to police intervention and subsequent filing of an FIR.
“Angry staffers alerted close investors, who rushed to the store.”

The ongoing investigation has raised questions about the internal operations of Torres and its leadership, highlighting the need for greater scrutiny in financial dealings.
